New Records: Jason Holder took four wickets in successive balls in the last over of the match, a career-best return of five for 27 in 2.5 overs
Key Match Events: Holder's dramatic last over where he dismissed Chris Jordan, Sam Billings, Adil Rashid, and Saqib Mahmood to secure the victory
West Indies won the series 3-2 after this match
Pre-Game Insights: Holder was playing at his home ground, giving him an advantage
England was missing key players due to the Ashes exertions
Post-Match Reflections: Holder was named player of the match and series for his performance
Pollard praised the team's effort and the contribution of substitute fielder Hayden Walsh Jr.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a significant win for the West Indies after a recent loss to Ireland
Holder expressed pride in the team's resilience and love for playing at Kensington Oval
